name: ABJKT#3: Business Microcycles (MK)
description:
Microwave on pave, 2021

And then a hundred years ago, during the infancy of radio technology, Kondratiev described the long waves of history; long 50-year waves of booms followed by busts followed by booms followed by recessions followed by expansions followed by contractions followed by bulls mating with bears, then long cycles of depressive orgasms, orgasmic depression, long and slow and sometimes painful. Everything was slower back then (though it wasn’t), but alas, soon after, in 1933, the first shortwave oven was presented to the public, heating up a piece of meat in mere minutes; so fast, finally freeing the hungry people from the shackles of history, it seemed (though it didn’t). Futurist technology, waves so short, becoming even shorter after the war, accelerating, ever shorter, ever faster, trembling, nervous ovens for nervous people, leftover food heated up unevenly, fridge-cold pasta on hot plates, fingertips burned, oh how it hurts. And then some confused person tries to dry their cat in the microwave oven, and Kondratiev, executed in 1938, is crying somewhere.
